Articles.Content: Calling 911 to tell them we won’t stop calling them for stupid reasons.
Calling 911 when you are 911 to complain about the stupid users and their stupid calls on stupid reasons.
Another reason to call 911 is the existence of this thread

Calling 911 because you said that if SLS ever launches you would have a heart attack and die, but now they're saying they will launch at the end of the month, so you're unsure if a heart attack is now fated to happen or if you would be obligated to make it happen.
Calling 911 because I HATE THE FLOOR
Calling 911 because nobody laughs when I tell them that stories about lithium-ion batteries should be put under the 'current events' section of the news website.
Calling 911 when you are a group of students having a fool-moon party at the abandoned summer camp built on the old Navajo cemetery, and suddenly see a strange figure with a sack on the head.

Calling 911 to ask why my cellphone gets more unreliable and signal gets weaker in proximity to spree killers and isolated murders.

("That's just the government-required Closed Circle Preservation Unit added to all phones, as demanded by the Writer's Guild.")
Calling 911 because it's the only working button on the found cellphone.

Calling 911 because I don't know what the little red button on the bottom of the gun does.

("You should have asked the manufacturer for that information.")
Calling 911 to report theft…of other forum games.
Calling 911 to make suggestions for ksp2
Calling 110 (our emergency number across the Pacific) to find out what calling 118 does (it notifies the JCG that someone's drowning)
Calling 911 to ask what's 119 for at the @Akagi's place.
Calling 911 for tonight’s special.
Calling 911 because it's the last number called by the previous phone owner.

Calling 911 to ask for a limerick.

("An accident, fire, or crime 
can happen any day, any time.
Our intervention is timely, 
with results that happen ideally,
When this idiot gets off of the line.")
Calling 911 to say Airbus is better than Boeing (actually, Tupolev and Ilyushin are the best)
Calling 911 because the other race team pitted a lap early and we don't know why, so we need to change our race strategy mid-race.
Calling 911 because I want SpaceX to re-launch the starlinks
Calling 911 because the already orbiting starlinks have shaded you from the Sun, so you think it's eternal night.
Calling 110(Chinese police) to destroy the starlinks.
Calling 911 to call 007.
Calling 911 to call 112 (European emergency hotline)
Calling 9112 to support the Euroatlantism.
